description: System metrics dashboard for apps instrumented with Kamon 2.x

panels.description: System resources usage
panels.title: System resources overview

panels.description: Tracks the current time the CPU is busy on user mode.
panels.title: CPU %usr

panels.description: Tracks the current time the CPU is busy on system mode.
panels.title: CPU %system

panels.description:
Tracks the current time the CPU is stuck waiting for IO.

If this value is high, the disk might be the bottleneck.
panels.title: CPU %wait

panels.description: Traks network usage
panels.title: Network usage

panels.description: Tracks ratio for failed network packets
panels.title: Retransmits

panels.description: Tracks usage of space on Disk
panels.title: Top 2 Disk usage

panels.description:
Tracks the system load average in 1m / 5m / 15m.

They indicate the average number of tasks (processes) wanting to run in the last 1m / 5m / 15m.

On Linux systems, these numbers is approximated and include processes wanting to run on the CPUs, as well as processes blocked in uninterruptible I/O (usually disk I/O).
This gives a high-level idea of resource load (or demand).

The three numbers give some idea of how load is changing over time.

Excellent post on the subject: http://www.brendangregg.com/blog/2017-08-08/linux-load-averages.html
panels.title: System load average

panels.description: Tracks the current time the CPU is busy by the process in user mode.
panels.title: Proc %usr

panels.description: Tracks the current time the CPU is busy by the process in kernel mode.
panels.title: Proc %system

panels.description:
Tracks the current time the CPU is stolen by some process outside the VM.

If this value is high, it could be caused either by the supervisor is very busy, by a noisy neighbor or by some limitation on the quota assigned by the virtualization service.
panels.title: CPU %steal

panels.description: Traks the usage of disk space
panels.title: Disk usage

panels.description: Tracks the number of file descriptors in used by the process.
panels.title: # FDs

panels.description:
Tracks the system load average in 1m / 5m / 15m.

They indicate the average number of tasks (processes) wanting to run in the last 1m / 5m / 15m.

On Linux systems, these numbers is approximated and include processes wanting to run on the CPUs, as well as processes blocked in uninterruptible I/O (usually disk I/O).
This gives a high-level idea of resource load (or demand).

The three numbers give some idea of how load is changing over time.

Excellent post on the subject: http://www.brendangregg.com/blog/2017-08-08/linux-load-averages.html
panels.title: System load average in 1m / 5m / 15m

panels.description:
Tracks the hiccups detected in the VM (also known as idle jitters) measured in nanoseconds. The 90ht percentile is presented.

For more info: https://www.azul.com/jhiccup/
panels.title: VM Hiccups (or idle jitters) in nanoseconds (p90)

panels.description: Tracks the usage of CPU by the VM in the different typical views.
panels.title: VM CPU usage

panels.description: Tracks the usage of CPU by the app in the different typical views.
panels.title: Process CPU usage

panels.description: Tracks the total memory available Vs. the amount of used memory.
panels.title: Host Memory

panels.description: Tracks the total swap memory available Vs. the amount of used swap memory.
panels.title: Swap Memory

panels.description: Tracks incoming and outgoing data through the network interfaces.
panels.title: Read / Write bandwidth

panels.description: Tracks incoming and outgoing failed packets on all network interfaces.
panels.title: Failed Read / Write packets

panels.description: Tracks usage of disk.
panels.title: Disk usage

panels.description: Tracks the amount of data transferred to disk device.
panels.title: Data transferred

panels.description: Tracks the number of completed disk I/O operations.
panels.title: Disk I/O (ops/sec)

panels.description: Tracks the amount of memory used by the JVM heap.
panels.title: Heap

panels.description: Tracks the amount of memory used by the JVM outside the heap.
panels.title: Off-Heap

panels.description: Tracks the distribution of GC events duration
panels.title: Garbage Collection

panels.description: Tracks the number of threads in use.
panels.title: Number Of Threads

panels.description: Tracks maximum number of Threads of the executors.
panels.title: Maximum Number of Threads

panels.description: Tracks minimum number of Threads of the executors.
panels.title: Minimum Number of Threads

panels.description: Tracks executor parallelism.
panels.title: Executor parallelism

title: Kamon 2.x - System metrics dashboard
